channel.title: Corrupt java?
channel.description:
well on my vps i have java installed and i have my source and client and my compiler working but i cant run my server because i get this error:
[code]Error loading: C:\Java\bin\msvcr71.dll [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: Launching HaxScape... [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: java.lang.OutOf MemoryError: Java heap space [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.world.WalkingHandler$TiledMap.<init>(WalkingHa ndler.java:63) [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.world.WalkingHandler.<init>(WalkingHandler.jav a:15) [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.world.WalkingHandler.<init>(WalkingHandler.jav a:7) [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.world.WalkingHandler$SingletonContainer.<clini t>(WalkingHandler.java:19) [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.world.WalkingHandler.getSingleton(WalkingHandl er.java:23) [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:145)[/code]
Any Help?

item.title: Corrupt java?
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Mine settles for -Xmx500. Nothing more, nothing less.

Read full topic

item.title: Corrupt java?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

^ This

there is a common run.bat issue with certain clients as well. If you think about the information in a run.bat for a client is will say like 512xm, 1024xm etc. You need to get the correct amount so java can run as it should.

Read full topic

item.title: Corrupt java?
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

MemoryError

You donâ€™t have enough memory to run the server, could you provide us with information about your computers specs? There could be too many processes running for the server to start, thus leaving Java to terminate.

Read full topic

item.title: Corrupt java?

item.description:
@SinfulScape wrote:

well on my vps i have java installed and i have my source and client and my compiler working but i cant run my server because i get this error:

Error loading: C:\Java\bin\msvcr71.dll [4/6/11 10:42 PM]: Launching HaxScape...
